My son went to see this movie with friends and has talked about how funny it is every since, he kept telling me to get it.

Today I come here to get the movie and I scanned the comments as I always do and was shocked.  I scrolled back up and looked at the cover, the thought never crossed my mind to see if it was black or white acting in it, it did not matter to me.  My son said it was funny so I wanted to check it out.

Base your like or dislike of a movie on how good it really is, the color of the actors does not matter.  I heard it was a good movie so I am going to watch it.

Did I mention I am white AND from the USA?  Don't let these racist idiots be a true representation of MY country that I signed up and swore to give my life to defend.

I think that humans tend to take note of their differences instead of their commonalities.  Any belief system, ideology. religion, or culture that causes a separation or segregation of the species, or if it divides the species, oppresses the species, exploits them , or places one human above another is a false and  destructive belief or ideological system whatever it may be. Although technologically, we may consider ourselves advanced, humans today still live and exercise the same belief systems that their ancestors did thousands of years ago. in essence, they are living a myth. 
   Ironically, humanity will never reach the epitome of its evolution untill all races meld into one. That human will possess all of the genetic information, immunities etc. of all of the races combined. That will be the most resilient human.  Humans place labels upon themselves in an effort to establish commonalities with others.  It affords them opportunities to make friendships and trusts. What if there were no religions, no cultures, or nationalities, or political parties etc.  What would our differences be then? The human species has suppressed itself by quibbling over its petty differences for tens of thousands of years.    And the very fact that you people are having this conversation makes my point perfectly clear.   
   Perhaps history will serve us best when when we finally learn to leave it where it belongs, which is in the past. History is to be learned from so that we may become wise. History is not intended for us to live.   
                                             Proceon..
